snippet: Holding Damascus is crucial for the government, which keeps its highest concentration of troops and its best-trained units in and around the city.
abstract: Syrian forces pummel outskirts of Damascus with artillery and airstrikes, apparently in an effort to insulate capital city, and cornerstone of Pres Bashar al-Assad’s rule, from rebels who have pushed deeper into suburbs along city’s eastern and southern edges.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA, ANNE BARNARD and HALA DROUBI
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada and Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: Holding Damascus is crucial for the government, which keeps its highest concentration of troops and its best-trained units in and around the city.

headline.seo: Syrian Forces Strike Rebels on Damascus Outskirts
headline.main: Syrian Forces, Seeking to Keep Hold on Capital, Strike Rebels on Its Outskirts
headline.print_headline: Syrian Forces, Seeking to Keep Hold on Capital, Strike Rebels on Its Outskirts

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
